dashboard.welcome.message: Welcome to DMP Tool, a service that helps you to create the Data Management Plan (DMP) for your project.

dmp.heading: What is a Data Management Plan (DMP)?

text.prefix: A data managment plan (DMP) translates data aspects of

gsp.body: (GSP) as well as general concepts of

rdmPolicy.title: RDM-Policy
rdmPolicy.body: into actions. It's a living document that describes how your research data will be created, managed, analyzed, stored and shared with others or - if sharing is not possible - justifying any access restrictions that have to be applied.

steps.heading: Follow the tool through steps 1-10 to provide the required information.
steps.body: You do not have to do all steps in one go, simply save the status and continue later. You can always go back and jump between steps. You may even invite colleagues from your institution to add information. If you wish, you can version your DMP.

text.prefix: When planning the data management for your project make sure that you are familiar with our institutional policies and procedures as well as national and international standards, policies and requirements and that you act accordingly!
text.title: Here
text.endPrefix: you will find relevant policies and standards.

export.heading: Export the DMP draft as a document.
export.body: Depending on the funder of your project, the exported DMP will either reflect the funder’s DMP template (FWF) or the DMP recommendations by Science Europe. This happens automatically for imported projects.

finalise.heading: Finalise your DMP in a text editor.
finalise.body: The exported DMP is an automatically created draft that you still need to add the finishing touches to. If you have a choice, we recommend editing in Word. Check the content carefully and complete any missing information, including the DMP version details on the cover sheet. Once ready, you can save your DMP as a PDF and provide it to the funder. Please note that you do not need to transfer your changes back into the DMP tool, as the created DMP document will be the basis for subsequent versions, not the tool.

update.heading: Regularly update your DMP.
update.body: A DMP is a living document and it is recommended to keep it up to date – for yourself, the project team, and the funder. The funders usually ask for updates at certain milestones and at the end of the project. Any changes can easily be done within the document, you do not need the tool for updates. Nevertheless, if you wish to add or change details and create a new version in the DMP tool, for example to update the machine-actionable information, remember to carefully check and complete the exported DMP as described above.

help.heading: Further help?
help.body: you will find further help for your DMP creation. You will find a 30 minute DMP tutorial, our quick help for creating a FWF-DMP, public example DMPs as well as information regarding DMP training courses.
